messages.subject: Re: Insight Needed
messages.messageBody:
<That's not a very broad or exciting list, for my tastes and range.
MAYBE he's a big reader and cook. Otherwise, it doesn't sound like
much choice.>

That is about as broad as he likes. Adrian is a one track kind of
guy and does not respond well to an overload of options. Also, those
are items that he DOES find exciting. If he was not interested, I
would not continue to offer them. He LOVES to cook and plan meals.
That is one thing that has not changed for him. He has always liked
food. Adrian also likes books VERY much. He prefers to be read to,
so I make myself available for reading whenever possible. We spend a
lot of time reading. He is into the Series of Unfortunate Events.
We are on book 6, and he owns them all. He did read one of them
himself, but still prefers me to read to him.

<Maybe you should plan some things that are more than opportunities.
A day trip (or overnighter, maybe, to see relatives and do something
in the other town), or a movie marathon (maybe you can borrow
favorite videos from friends) or. . . something entirely different.>

I have been thinking the same thing. Thank you for reminding me.
Adrian has a strong desire to travel. It's definately time to do
something on the road. Unfortunately, that can be rather difficult
for us, but we'll just have to figure a way.


<Below are some ideas pre-written and maybe you'll get others on this
list too.

http://sandradodd.com/museum
http://sandradodd.com/truck
http://sandradodd.com/checklists>

Thank you for the resources. I'll check them out...

Tina

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Insight Needed
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/10/04 1:31:37 PM, zoocrew@wideopenwest.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/10/04 1:31:37 PM, zoocrew@... writes:

<< I've been offering various books, opportunities to cook, he

participated in helping to plan a cooking class for local homeschool

kids that I offer once per month to a few local groups we belong to,

we talk a lot, read, watch History Channel (his choice, not mine),

etc. >>

That's not a very broad or exciting list, for my tastes and range.
MAYBE he's a big reader and cook. Otherwise, it doesn't sound like much
choice.

-=-He has a lot of opportunities presented daily. There is no

lack of opportunity or myself. I am with him everyday and

available. -=-

Maybe you should plan some things that are more than opportunities. A day
trip (or overnighter, maybe, to see relatives and do something in the other
town), or a movie marathon (maybe you can borrow favorite videos from friends) or.
. . something entirely different.

Below are some ideas pre-written and maybe you'll get others on this list too.

http://sandradodd.com/museum
http://sandradodd.com/truck
http://sandradodd.com/checklists

Sandra
